intro: Centaurea spruneriana, commonly known as the Spruner's cornflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its composite flower heads. Centaurea spruneriana is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it plays a role in supporting local biodiversity.
